Its a 5tp 15 min walk from various important destinations such as Suntech International Convention, City Hall MRT stop and Swissotel on Samford, which has a lot of eateries in the subway catering to all subsets of The East. Also would you find in that subway a pizza place, Starbucks, McDonald, economical Money changer, all of these just 5-7 mins walk. The Residence at SRC is indeed very neat and clean, compact with only 23 rooms. Rooms and bathrooms are nice with all basic amenities required. Staff very warm and courteous, will to help in all possible ways. The breakfast included in the stay was average. Other in-house recreation facilities such as gym, swimming pool, bowling lanes are all well kept. Budget travelers hitting the hotel just to sleep is a great option. Vey peaceful

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but not a luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: didiwritethis
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the Residence it feels like what it says, a recreation club that has some rooms for rent. All the 26 rooms are on the top (3rd) floor with half facing the quiet Padang and the others the noisy Connaught Road. When we booked we asked for a quiet room but did not get one despite having booked 4 months previously. The feeling we got was that they were reserved for the "members" as they were nicer rooms. We asked to be moved during our stay but were told it was not possible. Breakfast was included in our rate which was very good. The rooms were small but nicely furnished and strangely they all have a common balcony that anyone can walk around which means you have to keep the curtains closed as people walk past and look into the room. Another issue we had was the charge of $100 to our credit card upon arrival which they could not explain why they were making it but insisted that it had to be done and later credited off the bill. Compared to the other larger hotels in the area (Swisshotel just across the road) this was a very good room rate but obviously did not have the luxury or surroundings of those types of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting place- great for boat quay and surrounding area”
Reviews.Author: ranchale
Reviews.Content: Had a nice stay here with a room that opened out onto terrace over looking sports field and the sky scrapers over singapore. V clean, decent breakfast and friendly staff- would definitely go back! Good value for money for expensive Singapore. Also has free gym and pool plus other activities.

Reviews.Title: “My Residence in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: May12
Reviews.Content: Finding a good, centrally located hotel (that keeps you within budget)) in expensive Singapore is very taxing! Thanks to Tripadvisor, I found a hidden gem and I have been telling friends to consider it when visiting Singapore. A first impression that lasts is the genuine hospitality – from the confirmation of the booking to our check-out. I think everyone on night duty was informed about our midnight arrival, I was very happy with the efficient check-in as me and my mom were very exhausted from our KL side trip. The room looks and smells very nice! It combines the old charm and the conveniences of modern living. The bathroom and its fixtures are new -- beautiful and spacious! The toiletries are arranged very neatly. Unlike big hotels, we got immediate assistance for petty requests (such as adaptor, can’t find the light switch, etc) because they have a small reception area on the 3rd floor, just a few steps from the rooms. For the price and location, nothing beats the hotel -- a lot of must-see sights are accessible by walking. For further destinations, the City Hall MRT is just across the street from the main entrance. The hotel’s 3rd floor garden terrace provides a good view of the Esplanade and the Marina Bay Sands. The buffet breakfast is simple but tasty and adequate. We stayed only 1 night at the Residence coz I did not make my bookings early (they only have 28 rooms, I guess). We were not able to use the other facilities, especially the gym and the swimming pool, both of which look very well maintained. Learning my lesson well, I have already booked way advance for a 5-day return trip to MY Residence this April.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Bel_17
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small but clean and regularly serviced. Breakfast is a standard 'American/Asian' buffet, also some cereal and pastries. There is a bowling alley in the hotel which was fun and cheap. Free newspaper in the mornings. We emailed ahead to let them know we'd be arriving at 3am and they were ready for us. Basically, everything was above average for a less than average price. The downsides were very minor - the TV didn't work very well and the bathroom walls are frosted glass (though there are blinds you can put down). It is a two minute walk to the City Hall MRT stop, we also walked to Clarke Quay, Boat Quay, various malls, Singapore Arts Museum etc. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money - central location”
Reviews.Author: sebhoff
Reviews.Content: The combination of location and price is hard to beat. It's very close to "City Hall" MRT and many attractions are within walking distance. This place has been open for less than 2 years and many taxi-drivers still don't seem to know it. Just say you want to go to the Padang, opposite the Cricket Club, and everybody will know where to go... Rooms and breakfast are fine, though the normal coffee on offer is pretty awful. I asked and was given a coffee from the espresso machine, but I don't know whether that's normal procedure. I almost gave the hotel only 4 instead of 5 stars because they charge a lot for their own Internet access, which I just don't consider to be acceptable anymore today. But to be fair: the free service wireless@SG is available in much of the club and most of their rooms (not, for example, in their superior rooms, however) and they are happy to help you set up an account (you need a local mobile phone number to do this). They keep your luggage for you after you've checked out and you can take a free shower at the club before you leave for the airport in the evening - nice! They have a dress code in the club and hotel guests are expected to follow these rules, although quite a few don't seem to care (and get away with it).

Reviews.Title: “For the price you can't lose”
Reviews.Author: jiber
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and overall we were happy with the stay. The location was great. Right in the middle of town. It was close to numerous good shopping centers and right next to the train station too. The room was nice. The interior was nice but a little small around the bed in the room we stayed in. The other things about the hotel were also good. The pool was huge and heated. The gym although old but well equipped and you can get a solid and you can do everything you need there. The breakfast was free but don't expect anything special. But really for the price you can't do any better!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: CathyPortElizabeth
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at the SRC and loved every minute. The hotel was so central with easy access to the MRT and buses. The room was beautiful, comfortable and clean. Staff were friendly and helpful. Will definitley recommend it and would love to stay again if we return.

Reviews.Title: “excellent - very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: RichSue41
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little gem - the location is excellent and the staff very friendly and helpful. The room we had overlooked the Padang and whilst slightly small was very clean and with a great view of the Singapore skyline. Stayed for 2 nights and whilst had breakfast the first morning - which was more than adequate had to leave early in the 2nd morning and the breakfast was not available. We just had a 2 day stop over on our way to Sydney and thoroughly enjoyed Singapore and the hotel. Would definately recommend this hotel against some of the bigger hotels available.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Residence”
Reviews.Author: LaxmanBage
Reviews.Content: The reservation desk was very helpful (esp - Lita). The room 330 where we stayed for 3 nights was spacious with amenities of 5 star hotel standard. Other 3/4 star budget hotel at SRC price just provide pigeon hole . The hotel is located right at the center of city (hall).

Reviews.Title: “Superb value!”
Reviews.Author: platinumworld
Reviews.Content: The location is very central. The rooms are 5 star standard except a bit smaller. The value of rooms, F&B etc is the best money can buy in Singapore. The facilities are excellent. I will keep coming back to this place as it is ideal for business travellets like me....

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem of Singapore hotels”
Reviews.Author: yosaut
Reviews.Content: We, a family with 4 years old daughter, were on a short weekend trip to Singapore on mid January 2011. We stayed 2 nights at the residence of SRC. We arrived at the hotel around 9 pm due to delay on our flight. But even at that quite late time, the check in was easy and fast. Around 5 minutes we were already able to enjoy our room, a double bed deluxe room with balcony overlooking the Padang field. Our room is not too big, but it is a modern room and very clean. They have LCD TV with StarHub cables and even an alarm clock that includes iPod dock. The bathroom is also clean and equipped with hair dryer and all the amenities you need (soap, shampoo, tooth paste etc.) Breakfast is also good and tasty. You should try their chicken porridge. Really warm you stomach on a cloudy morning. The location of the hotel is very central. Very near to 2 MRT stations (i.e. City Hall station and Esplanade stations). Esplanade, Merlion Park and many Singapore's historical places are also in walking distance. If you want to try local food you can just go to the food court on Raffles City Mall or go to Makansutra Gluttonsbay foodcourt near Esplanade. To get taxi is also easy since many was passing by in front of the hotel. Just talk to the security at front door and they will help you to get your taxi. Or you can walk cross the street, go to in front of Swissotel Stamford loby and take a cab there since they have a taxi stand there. Not every taxi drivers are familiar with the residence, but you can mention Padang field or War Memorial Park to get you near the hotel, since most of the taxi driver is familiar with them. Just remember, since the residence is located within CBD area, you'll have to pay CBD surcharge in certain times. Tips: 1. Spend your morning with walking / jogging to the Esplanade, Merlion Park and the other historical places near the hotel. 2. Go to food court on Raffles City or Makansutra for abundant food selection around $4-$5 / plate. 3. Nice souvenirs can be bought on a 3 for $10 gift store in Suntec City Mall (1st floor, near winter clothing shop). Suntec City Mall is around 10-15 minutes walk from the residence.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for business - not for a family”
Reviews.Author: McSporran8
Reviews.Content: From the reviews we certainly expected more. If I'd been by myself on business I'd have said it was very good, but it didn't work for our family (two kids, 7 & 9). Our room was small and wasn't ready for us although we pre - booked. With the extra bed which we paid for it was more like three singles. I'm 5'10" and my feet stuck out the bottom of the spare! The premium for the room didn't extend to extra breakfast vouchers for the kids. No matter! While you get your wallet out for that you can settle your internet bill too, and it isn't cheap. For almost $300 a night (Singapore) is it too much to ask for free e-mail and a croissant? If you are there on business it would be great. It is clean and across the street from the tube and has the gym and pool which is well appointed though busy - again, with what looked to be the business crowd. Not for young kids, even if they meet the dress code.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Comfort Stay.. sure will be back”
Reviews.Author: goshocky
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the peak season of CommunicAsia 2010. The place is very strategic - within Marina Bay & Raffles. just 1-minute from nearest MRT station which is good. The room is lovely - like a 4.5 star hotel room - as I book the cheapest room but it's lovely. Nice decorated bathroom. Big LCD TV & iPhone/iPod dock. My room is facing the Padang which also facing the CBD which is lovely. However, the room is perfect for a single person. The service is good from the reception, small reception desk at 3rd floor (if I'm not mistaken). They're very friendly & humble. Plus the internet charge is very affordable at about <S$5 per 24 hours. The breakfast is quite normal but somehow it's nice as not much people around. I hope more improvement for the breakfast section. The facilities is great as you could use the recreation club facilities etc gym & pool which is beneath the hotel. Overall is good & worth it as I pay a slice of 4.5 star hotel rate during super peak season.

Reviews.Title: “I'll definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ricochet2046
Reviews.Content: The cost for hotel stay in Singapore is not cheap. This one is definitely a hidden gem. It is located just across the road from Riffles City (exit A, City Hall MRT). It is located on the 3rd floor (top floor) of the Singapore recreation club, so there is a nice view of the football field. There are 23 rooms, and they share a big balcony where you can enjoy the sunshine. The cost of one night stay is S$200(including tax). The club has it own attire rules (but since we dont wander around in the club/hotel, this doesnt bother us). Room are spacious. The breakfast is simple but adequate. It is served next to an indoor swimming pool. Its location make it easy to walk to marina bay, suntec city. It is also only a few min ride by MRT to little india, chinatown, orchard road. Do not miss it if you are going to singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore's perfect place to stay with a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: singaporeSeattle
Reviews.Content: Have visited Singapore many times, and this was my first stay at The Residence. It was wonderful from check-in to check-out. The staff is so friendly and helpful in all ways. You are made to feel at home. The location, so close to shopping and transportation, is just great. The poolside breakfast buffet is included in the room price, and very nicely presented. I will stay here on my next trip and recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & Service”
Reviews.Author: bluebell_black
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Singapore RC just after the very busy Grand Prix weekend and were informed that our room wouldn't be available as the Aircon was broken and all other rooms were occupied. Duncan the manager had arranged another room for us in a nearby hotel for the evening and by way of an apology treated us to an excellent meal at the R.C's poolside restaurant. Duncan then took us in a taxi to the other hotel and made sure we were given a good room. After nearly 18 hours of travelling we were exhausted but we were well looked after. The RC rooms are well furnished, clean and the breakfast is good. The location is excellent. Just hop over two main roads from the City Hall MRT and you're there. We took the MRT from the airport and it was no problem at all. The only concern i would have for leisure travellers is that on certain floors men are not permitted to wear shorts / t-shirts / sandals and this rule is stressed! So we just avoided these areas. We wouldn't book this hotel for a romantic getaway but if you want good value in a great location look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, how good is this?”
Reviews.Author: CheshireSunshine
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a weeks stay at The Residence with 2 friends. I will get rid of my criticism first as the room for 3 adults is not big enough and would be cosy for 2, but having said that the view from the room across the Padang was great despite the deconstruction of the National Day celebration stuff. The staff are so friendly and helpful, always taking the time to have a chat. Breakfast at the Poolside cafe is an added bonus and the food at other times is also worth a try as it is very reasonably priced. On check out keeping our bags for our night flight was not a problem and we were also told we could shower and change using the facilties in the gym area. This was again a pleasant surprise. Having visited Singapore several times before and stayed at The Fullerton and The Stamford I would not stay anywhere else in the future, thank you very much for a memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and comfy”
Reviews.Author: jcicious
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I've written a review for Tripadvisor, and I must say that I just love this place and felt the need to tell the staff and everyone thank you for such a wonderful stay. The room was very nice and clean. The breakfast was very good as well. I also had a very relaxing time at the pool. The most important thing for me when I stay at a hotel is the bed and bathroom - which at this place was very nice indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like a local in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: M4RK_H
Reviews.Content: This is a strange type of accommodation as it's actually a room within the building that forms the Singapore Recreation Club, but it's a great location and a good use of the building. Room we had was fairly small, but well equipped with everything we needed - nice bathroom, good bed, lcd tv, mini bar etc. The room backed out onto the tennis & cricket grounds, as well as the setup for the upcoming Youth Olympics taking place in Singapore. As a guest you can use the facilities of the recreation club which had a gym and an excellent underground swimming pool, which was a nice surprise to find in the city, as well as a sauna/steam room. Nice buffer breakfast included, looking over the swimming pool. Have stayed in the Scarlet and Rendezvous while in Singapore previously and this was a different type of accom, but just as good. Staff were all nice & friendly, would stay here again. Cost about £100/SIN$200 per night including buffet breakfast. Not the cheapest place by far, but a nice bit of history attached to the place to make it feel "not like a hotel"

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: happywanderer1954
Reviews.Content: I am reluctant to write a review for fear that others may discover this absolute gem. The Residence has only a small number of rooms and like most good hotels in Singapore, space is a premium, but you don't spend your holiday in a hotel room. It's only there to dump your luggage, shopping and rest before you go again. I enjoyed my stay at the Residence more than any of the other hotels that we have stayed at when visiting Singapore. It has everything you need to fill up any empty moments you may have. Several restaurants and lounges, a 10 lane bowling alley, a well equiped gym and pool complex, billiards room and casino [all mostly underground] and across the road The Swissotel Stamford and Raffles City complete with MRT. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the poolside cafe [B1] was excellent value for money for meals. Food is not normally expensive in Singapore except when dining in the restaurants of the hotels, however the poolside cafe is the exception to the rule. The food was good, inexpensive and the staff great. Our son in law decided to start eating curries while in Singapore and the chef at the Poolside Cafe made sure he had a different one on the menu each night just to tempt him. My husband & I love visiting Singapore and we would appreciate it if you would all stay someplace else as we intent to stay here again and do not want to share this gem in case we can't get a booking in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem for families with good facilities for children”
Reviews.Author: Nicole_and_Ben
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in July 2010 and we were really surprised by this fantastic place. With two kids (aged 6 and 8), the Residence did all it could to give us a great stay. We got in late after a late flight - so only needed a place to sleep. We had a queen bed and two singles in our room- so it was a bit small, but we could go out on to the terrace once the kids were asleep and this was a great space. The facilities include an underground pool, complete with a small water slide for the kids, a spa and steam rooms. There was also a basic play room for younger children and a full bowling alley - each game was less that $3 for guests. We didn't use the fitness room but did use the poolside cafe, which provided a great buffet breakfast included in the price. Staff were very friendly. One tip - as part of the Singapore Recreation Club the Residence does have a dress standard for men and women - no shorts, wear shirts with collars on weekdays (for men), etc. Best to check with the club before you go. The location is fantastic - it is right in the middle of the F1 track, which literally runs past the front door, and we had the privilege of witnessing some of the rehearsals for the Singapore National Day, which is a massive event held on the Padang - and the Singapore Recreation Club is at one end of the Padang. We would happily stay there again. We couldn't have been in a better spot with a MRT on the doorstep, the Raffles shopping Centre across the road and many sights in the Colonial district within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: FernandoCg
Reviews.Content: what can i say? excellent location (2 mins walk to the green line and red line metro station, 4mins walk to the yellow line metro station. easy to get to any main attractions in Singapore) , perfect serivce, very clean, new furnished modern room with high celling, boardband internet ( $22 SGD, 24 hrs acccumlated, very worth money). the only one disadvantge is safety box cant put in my laptop in inside, except it. i would say perfect !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay a stones throw from all the major attractions”
Reviews.Author: nilapatel78
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 6 nights and could have easlily stayed more. The residency is located opposite the Raffles City mall and City Hall MRT. This is not actually a hotel, it is a private sports and recreational club which has open up the residency part to the wider public. The reception and other staff memebers are really friendly and eager to help which makes your stay all the more better. The rooms are nicely decorated with ample space for your belongings. The bed was comfy and after sleeping in budget hotels, i had the best 6 nights sleep in a long time. The bathroom is compact, there is not much room to manovre if there were 2 of you in there. The rooms features a LCD tv and mini fridge. The use of the clubs facitilites are also available to you should you wish to use them. Breakfast was included and there is a selection of fruit, cereal, pastries, breads, local cusine and traditional english fry up. More than enough choise and variety. As mentioned in the previous comments, the Residency is in walking distance to the mall, Raffles hotel, Sun Tec city, the Esplanade, the Flyer and the Merlion. You could even walk to Little India and Orchard Road. There are plently of restaurants near by including coffee shops for a quick bite. Definatley would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Trip_Datum
Reviews.Content: We spend 4 days with my wife at the Residence and the experience is very positive. The location is fantastic, just opposite of the metro station and an enjoyable walk to most attractions and museums. Very close also to many restaurants and a 7 minutes walk to the CHIJMES complex. Rooms are a bit small but very nice decorated, cosy and (the room that I had) with a very nice view over the Padang and the Singapore business district. We really enjoyed the afternoons in the terrace in front of our room. Service is very good and all the staff very professional and willing to help. Only negative point is the average quality of the breakfast. Another very positive point: the 24-hours internet voucher is accumulative, so when you log out it stops charging you, and it expires after 30 days. I’ve used a 24-hours voucher over my entire stay there. Overall: a very good place to spend a long weekend or even more in Singapore. In terms of value it is a much better deal than the 5 star hotels of the city.
